feed.title: Your awesome title
feed.subtitle: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

entry.title: Julia: Installation and Editors
entry.content:
As a first post, I would like to talk about a new programming language which I'm currently investing my time on, and is called Julia. This post is a copy of my latest article from my old blog (Analysis with Programming). As the title says, I want to talk about on how to setup a Julia programming language on your machine. It's a well-thought-out language as many would say, and is by far my favorite, for many reasons. The first of course is the speed, second is the grammar, and many more. I can't list them down here, but I suggest you visit the official website, and try it for yourself.

Installation

The installation of this program is straightforward, simply go to the Julia's official download page and download the binaries for your operating system. Alternatively, you can install Julia by downloading the JuliaPro from the Julia Computing products. This will setup everything you need, which include the Github Atom Editor out of the box. After installation, the first time you load the command-line-version program, you'll have the following window:

entry.title: Introduction to Hypothesis Testing
entry.content:
Alhamdulillah!Arabic for "Praise be to God", Muslim common phrase.
  1. Abu Zakariya (2017). Jesus: Man, Messenger, Messiah. IERA Conveying the Call. ISBN: 978-1-910952-03-0.
  2. The Religion of Islam (2007). The Story of Jesus and Mary in the Holy Quran. Last Modified 2014 and 2017, Retrieved February 4, 2018.
  3. The Qur'an - Arabic Text with Corresponding English Translation (1997). Saheeh International, Abdulqasim Publishing House. ISBN: 9960-792-63-3, Riyadh.
  4. Bible Study (2018). Olive Tree Bible Software.
